decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:  17.110AxxxMS-P9202 P4, LUC-LD PLN 252 P2, 17.110AxxxE9201 P2, 17.110AxxxP9202 P4, LUC-LD PLN 251 P2, 17.110AxxxE9206 P2, 17.110AxxxMS-P9200 P3.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Temporary Planning Permission - Two (2) Years
The approved development shall be retained for a maximum period of up to five (5) years from the date of this permission.

Following the expiration of the five years, or any lesser period if the use of the building ceases, the space shall be returned to its original approved use as three (3) residential units (C3 Use Class). The façade and landscaping shall be reinstated in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 174205RMS.

Reason:  To ensure that the proposal is in accordance with the objectives of policy 1.1 (i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013). The Local Planning Authority is only prepared to grant permission for a limited period in view of the special circumstances raised by the regeneration masterplan for Acton Gardens Estate and the need to market new dwellings within the masterplan to generate finances to fund the regeneration scheme. | Use and Hours

The development hereby approved shall only be used as a marketing suite and show apartment (SG Use Class) for the sale of properties being developed as part of Acton Gardens Estate regeneration masterplan, which was granted planning permission under planning applications ref: P/2012/0708 and 182579OUT.

The building shall not be used by the public other than between 09:00h and 20:00h Monday to Sunday inclusive of Public Holidays and shall not be used by staff other than between 08:30h and 20:30h Monday to Sunday, inclusive of Public Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development is carried out and used in accordance with the approved details, and to ensure that the use of the building does not erode the amenity of neighbours, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013). | Sensitive spaces affected by transportation and commercial noise sources
Internal noise levels shall generated within the building envelope of the new premises shall not exceed 40 dB LAeq1hr.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ adjacent dwellings/ noise sensitive premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
subdivision_of_building: Current temporary marketing suite and show apartment at Phase 9.1
description: Temporary change of use of 3 flats (Use Class C3) to marketing suite/show apartment (Use Class E(c))
